column5: Had this for almost 40 years, at least. Its a hockey stick(small one, for autograph purpose only) signed by Bobby Hull. I want to know if it has any worth. Searched the net for any reference, could not find any.  My mom and I were at Sears and Roebuck(yeah, I am that old, lol) and Bobby Hull was there signing autographs. Stood in line and got this:   Close-up of the signature, which is real, I watched him sign it. I was probably 7 yrs. old at best.   Anyone have any idea of worth??  I also have this sticker, signed by Ken Money, and Marc Garneau, the latter was able to go up in the shuttle for sure, cannot remember if Ken did. They were at my workplace back in '84, met them both.   I would put this in the classified section, but I just want to know if there is any worth before I do.
Prolly not much Tom.Send it to me and I'll properly dispose of it. Joe
Yep...these generous OFC'rs never cease to amaze me Tom. If postage is tooooo steep to Virginia, you can send it to me to dispose of for you...
Yeah, Joe would probably use the stick to whack a catfish between the eyeballs without looking at the signature on the stick, lol

Found a few links for you to look at.....  http://auction.nhl.com/cgi-bin/ncommerce3/...;aunbr=80586917  http://www.grandstandsports.com/sport5.aspx?itemid=1267  The highest value I found was the second link....about $400.  Good luck!
Better yet Tom,fly down here for a spell and YOU can whack da catfish with it! Joe

I have/had ( it's buried around here somewhere) a mini stick singed by every player on team Canada (1994 I think) except Steve Yzerman, when team Canada was practicing in Collingwood for a week or so, and I was so dumb the mini stick had a sticker all the way down one side and it has since peeled off so now I have half signatures, lol.. I also have a picture autographed by Bobby Hull, he was at Don Cherries in Collingwood as well, it's with the stick somewhere.  I think cards and autographs are not as valuable as they used to be, but you never know if you find someone looking for a particular item.
Such a helpful group these guys...lol.  I can't be sure but I thing the guy you're looking for is fishinautographs or something and he's at Aylmer police college?  Maureen
kitfisher probably knows more about this but it seems like he changed his screen name or something :S
